RecordAlertCategory.name: RecordAlertCategory
RecordAlertCategory.description: Represents a category to group and present record alerts.

Description.description: The description of the record alert category.

DeveloperName.description: The unique name of the object in the API. This name can contain only underscores and alphanumeric characters, and must be unique in your org. It must begin with a letter, not include spaces, not end with an underscore, and not contain two consecutive underscores. In managed packages, this field prevents naming conflicts on package installations. With this field, a developer can change the object’s name in a managed package and the changes are reflected in a subscriber’s organization. Note When creating large sets of data, always specify a unique DeveloperName for each record. If no DeveloperName is specified, performance slows down while Salesforce generates one for each record.

FullName.description: Full name of the associated metadata type in Metadata API.

Language.description: Language of the record alert category.

ManageableState.description: Indicates the manageable state of the specified component that is contained in a package.

MasterLabel.description: Label of the record alert category.

NamespacePrefix.description: Namespace prefix associated with this object. Each Developer Edition org that creates a managed package has a unique namespace prefix.

Severity.description: Indicates the degree of impact that an alert in this category can have.
